---
title: "Instruction & Consultation"
---

This section highlights education and consultation efforts by the UCSB Library related to open science. These efforts take many forms, including hands-on workshops, course-integrated instruction, guest lectures, and individual or group consultations. Rather than listing individual sessions, we organized our inventory around open science topics addressed through instruction and consultation. Thus, a single session may engage multiple topics, and each topic may be addressed across many different instructional contexts.


### Foundational Data Literacy Module
This project aims to provide lower-division undergraduate students with foundational knowledge and practical data literacy skills. More information to come.

### Open science & data management planning
This topic covers planning for how research data and outputs will be created, documented, shared, and preserved throughout the research lifecycle. Instruction emphasizes aligning open science practices with funder requirements, disciplinary norms, and project goals.

**Example workshop**: Data management training for specific departments or programs; New faculty training in research data management and open science; Responsible Conduct of Research (RCR) training

### Methodological documentation
This topic focuses on documenting experimental procedures, workflows, and methods in ways that support transparency and reproducibility. Instruction highlights tools and practices for creating clear, detailed, and reusable methodological records.

**Example workshop**: Reproducible Methods with protocols.io

### Research process management
This topic addresses strategies for organizing and managing the research process, including literature, notes, decisions, and intermediate outputs. Instruction supports workflows that improve efficiency, traceability, and long-term project coherence.

**Example workshop**: Zotero Workshop, Document Your Research Thinking with Obsidian

### Ethical & responsible data practices
This topic emphasizes responsible approaches to working with data, including ethical considerations, data quality, and appropriate handling of sensitive information. Instruction often addresses practical challenges encountered when cleaning, organizing, and sharing data.

**Example workshop**: Carpentries Workshops; Tidying Messy Spreadsheet with OpenRefine; Handling and Sharing Qualitative Data Responsibly and Effectively
